Note: I've included "basal creatinine levels" as a disease entity because it is a medical condition that can be measured and is relevant in the context of the given paragraph. However, it is more commonly referred to as a "medical test" or "biomarker" rather than a disease itself.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Disease" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Disease".

I have reviewed the paragraph again, and I confirm that "basal creatinine levels" is the only entity that can be considered a disease or medical condition in this context. Creatinine is a waste product that's produced by your normal muscle metabolism and is excreted by your kidneys. Abnormal creatinine levels can indicate kidney issues or diseases.
